numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph has the name "The generational views on the future of our planet".
2. People who are 15 to 24 years old are more optimistic than other people.
3. People who are 15 to 24 years old view progress in the world in a positive way.
4. Only a small percentage of people who are 40 years old or older view the world in an optimistic way.
5. Most of these optimistic people who are 40 years old or older are from African countries.
6. A small percentage of these optimistic people who are 40 years old or older are from India.
7. We wonder why the younger age group is more optimistic than the older age group.
8. We wonder whether the development of a country affects how people in the country view the world.
10. All of us are 15 to 24 years old.
11. It is interesting for us to see how people like us view the world.
13. There is hope in our generation.
14. There is optimism in our generation.
16. There is hope in future generations.
17. There is optimism in future generations.
